definition: chess/chess-like game/a game of chess/CL:盤|盘[pan2]/chess piece/CL:個|个[ge4],顆|颗[ke1]

sentences.english: Feints and stratagems are the stuff of chess.
sentences.chinese: 佯裝與計謀都是下象棋常耍的把戲。

sentences.english: In the chess game, he advanced his pawn forward two spaces.
sentences.chinese: 下國際象棋時，他讓兵前進了兩格。

sentences.english: In the Chinese chess, the chariot takes in a straight line.
sentences.chinese: 在中國象棋裏“車”沿直線喫子。

sentences.english: O The chess control balance helps to detect the errors that do not influence equalities .
sentences.chinese: 國際象棋控制的平衡，有助於偵測錯誤，不影響等式。

sentences.english: My win at chess raised my spirits a little.
sentences.chinese: 我贏了這盤國際象棋纔打起了一點精神。

sentences.english: I'd rather not play chess, actually.
I like playing computer games, playing the piano and playing chess.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡玩電腦，彈鋼琴和下象棋。

sentences.english: "We used to offer only weiqi and Chinese chess in our club, " says Wang.
sentences.chinese: “以前，我們社團裏只有圍棋和象棋，”王峯說。

sentences.english: Chess whizz, for example, recognize patterns more quickly than amateurs.
sentences.chinese: 例如，象棋專家比業餘愛好者更快地識別模式。

sentences.english: He challenged me to play chess.
Chess, for example, began in India before the sixth century.
sentences.chinese: 例如，國際象棋最早起源與六世紀前的印度。

sentences.english: In high school, I spent my time playing chess, fencing, and sailing.
sentences.chinese: 高中的時候，常常玩象棋，還玩擊劍和帆船。

sentences.english: Ma Ma likewise Chinese chess, and take on other characters but not full, free driving.
sentences.chinese: 馬亦同中國象棋的馬，走日字但不別足，自在馳騁。

sentences.english: It is estimated that over half a billion people in China know how to play Chinese chess.
sentences.chinese: 據估計，在中國有超過五億人懂得下象棋。

sentences.english: On display is one of the earliest surviving chess sets, made by hand from a type of pottery in Iran in the 12th century.
sentences.chinese: 展出的則是十二世紀伊朗陶製的國際象棋棋盤。

definition: land battle chess, Chinese board game similar to Stratego
